message.content:
cs.SI, cs.SOC, cs.CYBER, cs.HC, cs.IT

Reasoning: 
1. cs.SI (Social and Information Networks) - The paper discusses the Living Cognitive Society as an ecology of interacting social subsystems, which can be seen as a network of relationships. The disruptive effects of Information and Communication Technologies on the mechanisms at work are also discussed, which falls under the scope of this sub-category.
2. cs.SOC (Social and Behavioral Sciences) - The paper proposes a conceptual framework for thinking about a dynamically changing social system, which is a topic of interest in social and behavioral sciences. The discussion on sustainable social systems also falls under this sub-category.
3. cs.CYBER (Cybersecurity and Privacy) - The disruptive effects of Information and Communication Technologies on the mechanisms at work, as discussed in the paper, can also be seen as a cybersecurity and privacy concern.
4. cs.HC (Human-Computer Interaction) - The paper discusses the effects of Information and Communication Technologies on the mechanisms at work in the Living Cognitive Society, which can be seen as a topic of interest in human-computer interaction.
5. cs.IT (Information Theory) - The paper discusses the disruptive effects of Information and Communication Technologies on the mechanisms at work in the Living Cognitive Society, which can be seen as a topic of interest in information theory.
